intro: Tithymalus spinosus, commonly known as the spiny tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly rough texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tithymalus spinosus is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
